discussion.content:
Based on the below, I think HIPPA answer is correct.

"A HIPAA release form must be obtained from a patient before their protected health information is disclosed for any purpose other than those detailed in 45 CFR §164.506, which are specifically covered in 45 CFR §164.508 and summarized below:

Prior to the disclosure of PHI to a third party for reasons other than the provision of treatment, payment or other standard healthcare operations – E.g. disclosing information to an insurance underwriter
Prior to PHI being used for marketing or fund-raising purposes
Prior to PHI being provided to a research organization
Prior to psychotherapy notes being disclosed
Prior to the sale of PHI or sharing that involves remuneration"

comments.content:
Having said that, there are 2 parts to this question. 
1. HIPPA release form must be obtained from a patient
2. Chain of custody form.

Without the HIPPA release form, whoever presents the information in court will be held liable. Without a Chain of Custody, information is invalid. 
Given the question focused on a "hospital network", I would choose HIPPA release form as the best answer, otherwise, Chain of custody form would always be the answer.

those situations just refer to a possible PROACTIVE disclosure of that information. That patient should be informed if that data will be shared (and with which purposed).

But the main point of the question is about handling evidence in court, which leads to CHAIN OF CUSTODY FORM. The point that this is taking in a hospital is secondary, imho

discussion.content: B is a red herring. Just because the data breach occurred in a hospital, doesn't mean PHI was exfiltrated. C is correct answer.

This is with 99.9% certainty C. Chain of Custody: https://legaldictionary.net/chain-of-custody/#:~:text=In%20criminal%20cases,%20the%20defendant%20may%20petition%20the%20court%20to%20exclude%20evidence%20that%20the%20prosecution%20obtained.
Is it not a HIPPA release form? So the answer should be C instead?

comments.content: I think its C also. Any data to be used in the court must have proof/validation using chain of custody form. Without that, the evidence will be rendered useless.

questions.question_text: A cyber-incident response team is responding to a network intrusion incident on a hospital network. Which of the following must the team prepare to allow the data to be used in court as evidence?

comments.content: I take back my answer, it's correct

discussion.content:
This should be B

The response code of 401 lacks authorization, nothing leads to a breach with that.
But with response code 200, it's an OK status, it mean The request was fulfilled.

questions.question_text: A user received an invalid password response when trying to change the password. Which of the following policies could explain why the password is invalid?

discussion.content: How SNI Works. ... SNI allows a web browser to send the name of the domain it wants at the beginning of the TLS handshake. This in turn allows the server hosting that site to find and present the correct certificate. And all sites running on that server can share the same IP address and ports. AE

Answer should be B and E
A link is provided and there is an IP. This is a remote server and not a localhost which the second query does. So it should be B and E as the best options

Can anyone explain this in human language? I don't understand this one at all. B & C seem illogical to me, so that leaves A, D & E. Since there was a "finding", I'm eliminating D as well. That leaves A and E, but I don't know why.

comments.content: question asks for two options so i would also choose e

discussion.content: Isn't this C? host not found on hrserver because it there it cant resolve that hostname into ip address

choices.A: The web server uses SNI to check for a domain name
choices.B: Requests can only be sent remotely to the web server
choices.E: There is no local name resolution for hrserver internal.
choices.D: The web service has not started
choices.C: The password file is write protected

questions.question_text:
A security analyst wants to confirm a finding from a penetration test report on the internal web server. To do so, the analyst logs into the web server using SSH to send the request locally. The report provides a link to https://hrserver.internal/../../etc/passwd, and the server IP address is 10.10.10.15.
However, after several attempts, the analyst cannot get the file, despite attempting to get it using different ways, as shown below.
//IMG//

Which of the following would explain this problem? (Choose two.)
